questions.question: Confirm the equipment with below provided image.
upload the image of the equipment, contact the technical team for recorrections and scan the bar cod again
confirm is there any physical damage of the equipment.
prepare the Damage / Incident and Missing Report.
connect the equipment to the mains and confirm whether the equipment is getting ON.
check and confirm whether the wall outlet is provided with AC voltage of 230

videos.src: assets/videos/Crticare n genuity/VIDEO FOR CHECKING WALL OULET VOLTAGE.mp4
videos.videoName: VIDEO FOR CHECKING WALL OULET VOLTAGE

questions.question: shift the equipment to another place where AC voltage of 230 is provided
check the power cord continuity and confirm whether the power cord is defective.

videos.src: assets/videos/Crticare n genuity/VIDEO FOR CHECKING POWER CORD CONTINUITY.mp4
videos.videoName: VIDEO FOR CHECKING POWER CORD CONTINUITY

questions.question: replace the power cord with a new one
check the continuity of fuse and confirm whether the fuses are blown.
replace the fuse with a new one
open the equipment as shown in the video, check and confirm whether the input AC voltage of 230 is available
check whether there is any carbon formation / breakage of input pin connector.
clean / replace the input pin connector accordingly
check for any loose connection / breakage of cable from pin connector to power supply board.
reseat / replace the cable accordingly
check and confirm whether the power supply output voltage is available.
repair / replace the power supply accordingly
check and confirm for any loose connection or breakage of cable from Power supply Board to control board.
reseat or replace the cable accordingly
repair or replace the control board accordingly
check and confirm whether the BP Cuff deflates immediately or improper deflation after the inflammation
cross check the NIBP Cuff and confirm for any damage and breakage in the tubing.
replace the NIBP cuff with a new one
open the equipment as shown in the video, check for loose connections or breakage of tubing from NIBP connector pin to solenoid and motor.
reseat / replace the tubings accordingly
check and confirm whether 500 – 700 ohms is available at the solenoid.
replace the solenoid with a new one
repair / replace NIBP module accordingly
check and confirm whether there is no inflammation of cuff during NIBP is measured.
cross check the cuff and confirm for any damage or breakage of the cuff.
replace the cuff with a new one
replace the NIBP pump with a new one
check and confirm whether the leads off message appears on the screen.
check and confirm for any loose connections or breakage of cable pin connector
reconnect or replace the cable pin connector with a new one
cross check the lead cable with another and confirm whether the cable is defective.
replace the cable with a new one
open the equipment as shown in the video, check and confirm whether there is any loose connection or damage of cable from pin connector to module.
reseat / replace the cables accordingly
repair / replace the parameter module accordingly
check and confirm whether Sensor off / SPO2 off message appears on the display.
check the pulse Oxi probe connector for any damage / improper connection.
replace the connector with the new one / reconnect properly
open the equipment as shown in the video, check and confirm whether there is any loose connection or damage of cable from pin connector to module.
reseat / replace the cables accordingly
repair / replace the parameter module accordingly
check and confirm whether the equipment is getting ON but the display is black / plain.
open the equipment as shown in the video, replace the backlight board with a new one
check and confirm whether the equipment is getting ON but the display appears as plain white.
, check and confirm is there any loose connection or breakage of cable from control board to display.
replace or reseat the cable accordingly
replace the display with a new one
If the problem is not yet solved, contact the technical team for any other assistance through video call.
Thanks
